intro: Decaloba organensis, commonly known as the organensis decaloba, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are palmately lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several national parks.
